message.content:
<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: import java.io.*;import java.util.*;public class DataStreams {    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {        try {            File file = new File("C:\\data.txt");            if (!file.exists()) {                file.createNewFile();            }            DataOutputStream out = new DataOutputStream(new FileOutputStream(file));            for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {                out.write(i);            }            out.close();        } catch (IOException ioe) {            System.out.println("No file exist");        }    }}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue is that the file may not exist at the path you specified. Before writing to a file, you should always check if the file exists and if it doesn't, create a new one. In the provided code, I added a check to see if the file exists and if it doesn't, it creates a new one. Also, don't forget to close the DataOutputStream after you're done using it to free up system resources.
